edge: Murder 2 is the second installment in the Murder film series.
Both Emraan Hashmi and Jacqueline Fernandez star in the movie Murder 2.
Murder 2 is a Hindi-language thriller film.
Arjun Bhagwat is a money-hungry ex-cop involved in committing crimes.
Priya, a model, appears in the movie Murder 2.
Arjun Bhagwat regularly visits the church in the movie Murder 2.
Priya harbors romantic feelings for Arjun in the movie Murder 2.
A woman tries to entice Arjun Bhagwat at the beginning of the movie Murder 2.
Murder 2 is a quasi-sequel to the 2004 film, Murder.
The movie Murder 2 is allegedly inspired by the Nithari killings in Noida.
Arjun Bhagwat can only have a no-strings-attached relationship, and nothing else.
Priya suggests finding someone else if she wants love in the movie Murder 2.
The movie Murder 2 is remembered for its erotic scenes.
Arjun Bhagwat only lusts after Priya's marvelous body in the movie Murder 2.
Priya reveals to harbor romantic feelings for Arjun Bhagwat at the church, where he regularly visits to donate money to orphans in the movie Murder 2.
The movie Murder 2 became one of the highest grossing Bollywood films of 2011.
Murder 2 is a thriller film.
Arjun Bhagwat is an atheist in the movie Murder 2.
The movie Murder 2 is reportedly an unofficial adaptation of the South Korean film, The Chaser.
Mukesh Bhatt produced the movie Murder 2.
The movie Murder 2 was directed by Mohit Suri.

The scene featuring the song 'Haal-E-Dil' had to be partly re-shot in order to make it more suitable for use in television promos.
Yana Gupta's item number 'Aa Zara' was not shown during television promos as it was deemed too violent for audiences under 18.
An alternative music video for the song 'Aa Zara' was shot with Jacqueline Fernandez and Emraan Hashmi, which was aired on television and was used to promote the song.

Taran Adarsh of Bollywood Hungama gave it 4/5 stars and wrote: "Murder 2 is one of the finest crime stories to come out of the Hindi film industry. Also, as a film, it lives up to the expectations that you may associate from a sequel of a smash hit". Nikhat Kazmi of The Times of India gave it 3.5/5 stars commenting, "Murder 2 has enough to give the masses a mast time". IANS gave it 3/5 stars.

The DVD of the film was released on 1 August 2011.

rated Murder 2 with 3/5 stars and said that "it doesn't have too much to offer in terms of entertainment as it is a dark film but its plus points are the abundant sex scenes and the good music. Its reasonable budget on the one hand, and wonderful recovery from sale of its satellite, music and worldwide theatrical rights on the other have ensured that the producers have made a handsome profit before release".

Murder 2 is a movie featuring Emraan Hashmi.
At best, Murder 2 is a show reel for the talented Prashant Narayanan.
The film Murder 2 features Jacqueline Fernandez in a saucy role.
Saibal Chatterjee and Raja Sen both reviewed the movie Murder 2.
The overall film collected a gross of ₹115 crore with a budget of ₹50 crore worldwide. The all India distributor share stood at ₹250 million (US$3.0 million).
As of February 2012[update], Box Office India claimed that it was the 28th biggest opening week of all time.
Despite new releases, the movie dominated the single screens.
The producers released a third film Murder 3, on 15 February 2013.
The film's music was to be composed by the original murder film composer Anu Malik. He even recorded the first song but was sacked and replaced by new composers.
The film's score was composed by Raju Singh,
All songs became popular in 2011. Lyrics are penned by Mithoon,
Songs were composed by Mithoon, Harshit Saxena and Sangeet-Siddharth.
The album received positive reviews from critics. Joginder Tuteja from Bollywood Hungama gave the album a 3/5 stars saying that "Murder 2 turns out to be a good deal overall"
The album received positive reviews from critics. Musicaloud gave the album 3.5/5 stars.[citation needed]
